newsitem.title: UK: London stocks retreat from recent record levels.
newsitem.headline: London stocks retreat from recent record levels.

text.p: The FTSE 100 index shed more of its recent gains on Wednesday but finished off the day's worst levels despite a sharp early sell-off in New York.
A lack of fresh domestic company and economic news helped to subdue activity and lacklustre UK stocks took their lead from an overnight sell-off across the Atlantic.
The FTSE 100 index finished 28.8 points lower at 4,028.4 in moderate volume of 630 million shares. Losers outweighed gainers by roughly three-to-one.
"The market definitely turned today," said one dealer. "We were getting a little too blase about going up 20-points a day."
